title: Davos takes stock of a transatlantic alliance trampled by Trump
subhead: The American president's threats toward Greenland and, more broadly, his contempt for Europe dominated discussions and speeches on Tuesday at the Economic Forum. French President Emmanuel Macron called for rejecting 'the law of the strongest.'

title: Le Pen delivers well-rehearsed argument at  embezzlement appeal trial
Affordability has become a dominant political issue in the US
Marine Duc, geographer: 'In Greenland, the memory of colonial violence remains strong'
subhead: Donald Trump's ambitions for the Arctic island have affected Danish policies toward the Inuit population and influenced the expression of Greenlandic nationalism, the academic explained in an interview with Le Monde.

title: 'The Wizard of the Kremlin': An epic tale of power through the eyes of a man in the shadows
subhead: Director Olivier Assayas seeks to shed light on how Russia came to fall under the grip of Vladimir Putin, played by Jude Law.

title: Claude Le Roy: 'The Senegalese players were overwhelmed by emotion and completely lost control'
subhead: Claude Le Roy, the former coach of Senegal, Cameroon, Ghana and Togo discusses the confusion that marred the Africa Cup of Nations final between Morocco and Senegal and the governance of world football.

title: In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
subhead: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?

title: Trump's 'board of peace' fails to spark enthusiasm among world leaders
subhead: The US president has invited around 60 countries to join a committee originally designed to oversee the reconstruction of Gaza. Yet the White House has since scaled back its ambitions for this 'international organization.'

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.
